metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7076 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sudo before version 1.8.18p1 is vulnerable to a bypass in the sudo noexec restriction if application run via sudo executed wordexp() C library function with a user supplied argument. A local user permitted to run such application via sudo with noexec restriction could possibly use this flaw to execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1
sudo-ldap - 1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> See also CVE-2016-7032 This alert mentions a seccomp-based filter. If we decide to backport that filter for this CVE, and CVE-2016-7032, then 'medium' may continue to be appropriate. If we decide the seccomp-based filter is not suitable for a backport, then perhaps 'negligible' would be appropriate.

criterions.comment: sudo package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.8.19p1-1ubuntu1').
